author: Jaykul
body:
When creating junction points and removing them, Remove-Item in PowerShell 7 does not work, and produces an incomprehensible error:

> Remove-Item : Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/192942/66512538-2bfdc480-eaa7-11e9-8ea5-d699b3fb7228.png)

See Also: [Regression: Get-ChildItem modes are wrong with junctions](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/10748) #10748 
See Also: [Fix Remove-Item <symbolic link to directory>](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/621) #621

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# Create a junction point
# E.g. Install-Package from the NuGet provider with a `-Destination`
Register-PackageSource -Name NuGet -Trusted -ProviderName NuGet -Location https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json -Force -ForceBootstrap
Install-Package YamlDotNet -Source NuGet -Destination . -Force -ExcludeVersion

# Review the created junction point 
# PowerShell 7 pre 4 initially displays it as a directory, not a junction
Get-ChildItem YamlDotNet*

# Attempt to remove the directory
# This produces the error:
#    Remove-Item : Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list.
Remove-Item YamlDotNet -Recurse
```

# Expected behavior

- `Remove-Item` should remove the junction
- Failing that, it should _at least_ work as well as Windows PowerShell 5
  - It should produce an error message like:
    > Remove-Item : .\YamlDotNet is an NTFS junction point. Use the Force parameter to delete or modify this object.
  - `Remove-Item YamlDotNet -Force -Recurse` should remove the junction

# Actual behavior

It's impossible to remove this with PowerShell Core 7 due to the FormatException: Index (zero based) must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the size of the argument list.

# Environment data

